intro: Rhaptostylum microcalyx, commonly known as the small-fruited rhaptostylum, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species within its native range.
